EmailTemplate.subject: It's almost Christmas - Volunteer & bring some cheer!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
*|MC:SUBJECT|*
Give time, get ahead this Christmas!
Fareshare aims to fight hunger and tackle food waste by sending out food to charities and community groups. This is an amazing opportunity for you to get involved with helping those less fortunate by sorting and distributing food at food banks.
How to sign up? Visit the Fareshare website to contact your local distribution centre.
Operation: Christmas Child.Build a shoebox for a child in need, Samaritan’s Purse will send it and it can all be done online!
How to sign up? Complete the form on the Samaritans’ Purse website.
Volunteer with Crisis to help homeless people this Christmas. Crisis have a wide range of roles for you to get involved with. If you want to interact with different people and be in a festive environment,this is for you!
How to sign up? Register as a volunteer on the Crisis website.
The Soup kitchen provides free meals for vulnerable people everyday. You can get involved with prepping and serving meals or helping out in the office. This is a brilliant way for you to get involved with giving back to people in need this Christmas.
How to sign up? Email soupvolunteer@amchurch.co.uk for more information.
Teenage Cancer Trust is dedicated to creating world-class cancer services for young people in the UK so young people don’t have to face cancer alone. You have the opportunity to fundraise at a local Sainsburys store for this great cause!
How to sign up? Check out the volunteering opportunities and email volunteers@teenagecancertrust.org
The British Red Cross aims to help people in crisis whoever and wherever they are. They provide services such as protecting people in conflict and refugee support. If you want to fundraise and campaign for this cause, get involved this Christmas!
How to sign up? Check out the volunteering opportunities in your area.
Card Aid works with over 200 charities to donate proceeds for selling charity Christmas cards. This a great way to get in the Christmas spirit by selling Christmas cards for a great cause.
How to sign up? Check out the Card Aid website and email volunteers@cardaid.co.uk
